key_insight: VA-π introduces a lightweight post-training variational objective that aligns autoregressive token policies with pixel-space reconstructions, reducing the mismatch between token-likelihood optimization and final image quality.
problem_solved: Addresses the misalignment between tokenizers (trained to reconstruct clean images) and autoregressive generators (trained only on token likelihood), which leads to token sequences that decode into low-quality or artifact-prone images without pixel-level supervision.
method: Formulate a variational policy alignment objective that links the AR token policy to the tokenizer's pixel-space decoder, enabling direct pixel-aware optimization of generation.
Post-train the AR generator (no tokenizer retraining) by sampling decoded images, computing pixel-level (or perceptual) feedback, and updating the token policy via the variational objective.
Keep the procedure lightweight and plug-in: preserves existing tokenizers and likelihood-based training while reducing reconstruction artifacts through targeted fine-tuning.
impact: Provides a practical, low-cost way to improve visual fidelity of autoregressive image models by directly aligning token generation with pixel outcomes—useful for practitioners deploying AR-based image synthesis who want better decoded image quality without retraining tokenizers.

paper_title: VA-$π$: Variational Policy Alignment for Pixel-Aware Autoregressive Generation
paper_authors: Xinyao Liao, Qiyuan He, Kai Xu, Xiaoye Qu, Yicong Li
